metadata.synopsis: An Absolute guard protecting crates at the dock. The crates contain tadpoles, intended to infect the citizens of Baldur's Gate. The guard doesn't know this, and if we force the knowledge on him his mind breaks.

29.speaker: Acolyte Marls
29.text: Worms. Do you feel them? Feel them crawling?
29.context: NodeContext: Breathy, panicked - you've broken his mind a little

32.speaker: Acolyte Marls
32.text: Not long before they march on the city.

35.speaker: Acolyte Marls
35.text: I'm afraid you missed the ship, True Soul.
35.context: NodeContext: Friendly - speaking to an equal (he believes)

51.speaker: Acolyte Marls
51.text: But there'll be another along soon enough. We're already stacking the cargo.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: gestures nondescriptly at nearby crates

76.speaker: Acolyte Marls
76.text: Baldur's Gate. The army marches overland, but we've sent some friends ahead to smooth the way.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Why does the Absolute want to make war with the city?

33.speaker: Acolyte Marls
33.text: Locals need to see Her truth - take their place in Her design.

63.speaker: Acolyte Marls
63.text: Or they don't, and we send them to meet the old gods they cling to. Doesn't matter much either way.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Your friends are bringing unusual cargo with them.

77.speaker: Acolyte Marls
77.text: Nothing of note. Just supplies for the battle ahead - I've already checked it twice over.

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
65.context: InternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Your job is to guard. Leave the details to me, yes?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: The cargo's important. Another look can't do any harm.

10.speaker: Acolyte Marls
10.text: Eh... right you are, I suppose. Check away.
10.context: NodeContext: Hesitantly. Doesn't see the sense in our double-checking his work, but we're throwing our weight around and he's letting us.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Then you won't mind stepping aside and letting me look.

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *As you bear down on his mind, you feel a pulse in response. A thousand pulses, echoing from the nearby crates.*

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *Tadpoles. His mind had rejected the knowledge, forced it behind a mental wall. A wall you just took a hammer to.*

30.speaker: Acolyte Marls
30.text: W-worms. Worms in their heads. Worms all over!
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide-eyed, repeating over and overNodeContext: Breathless, near-catatonic with shock

28.speaker: Player
28.text: You had best wash them off.

46.speaker: Acolyte Marls
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: He holds his head in panic, then after dialogue leaps into the water and vanishes from sightNodeContext: Breathy, panicked - you've broken his mind a little

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Guard duty's boring. You're letting your imagination run away with you.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *And as quickly as you tore down his defences, you shore them back up. His mind is blank, and blissfully ignorant once more.*

84.speaker: Acolyte Marls
84.text: ...Hm? Oh, True Soul. You just missed the ship - but there'll be another one along soon.

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Then you won't mind stepping aside and letting me look.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Think hard. What's really in the boxes?

22.speaker: Acolyte Marls
22.text: It's just food. Supplies. Like I said.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Think hard. What's really in the boxes?

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *A strange sensation courses through you, and your companion's mind unfolds, secrets half-revealed.*
44.context: InternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to an NPC.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Then you won't mind stepping aside and letting me look.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Then you won't mind stepping aside and letting me look.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Think hard. What's really in the boxes?

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Think hard. What's really in the boxes?

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I checked the cargo. It's a little unusual.

60.speaker: Acolyte Marls
60.text: Don't see how, True Soul. It's just supplies going ahead of the troops.

71.speaker: Acolyte Marls
71.text: Another along soon, True Soul. Another. Another...
71.context: NodeContext: Starts out cheerfully, trails off slightly confused. Meant to be eerie - we broke his mind and then patched it back together - this phrase it all he's hanging onto

75.speaker: Acolyte Marls
75.text: Worms. Crawling under my skin. Get them off, get them off!

85.speaker: Acolyte Marls
85.text: I'm on duty, True Soul. Sorry.
85.context: NodeContext: Stiff, awkward, a little wary of us. We're his superior but he thinks we might be a little unstable.
